parameters.name: ReverseDir
parameters.description: True reverses the angle direction, false does not

parameters.name: RevType
parameters.description: Type of revolution as defined in swRevolveType_e (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Thickness1
parameters.description: Wall thickness1 (ReverseThinDir = 2 uses (thickness1)/2 for each direction)

parameters.name: ReverseThinDir
parameters.description: Type and direction as defined in swThinWallType_e

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies the feature affects (see Remarks )

title: IFeatureManager.FeatureRevolveThinCut
signature:
Feature FeatureRevolveThinCut( 
   System.Double
Angle
,
   System.Boolean
ReverseDir
,
   System.Double
Angle2
,
   System.Int32
RevType
,
   System.Double
Thickness1
,
   System.Double
Thickness2
,
   System.Int32
ReverseThinDir
,
   System.Boolean
UseFeatScope
,
   System.Boolean
UseAutoSelect
)

parameters.name: ReverseDir
parameters.description: True reverses the angle direction, false does not

parameters.name: RevType
parameters.description: Type of revolution as defined in swRevolveType_e (see Remarks )

parameters.name: Thickness1
parameters.description: Wall thickness1 (ReverseThinDir = 2 uses (thickness1)/2 for each direction)

parameters.name: ReverseThinDir
parameters.description: Type and direction as defined in swThinWallType_e

parameters.name: UseFeatScope
parameters.description: True if the feature only affects selected bodies, false if the feature affects all bodies

parameters.name: UseAutoSelect
parameters.description: True to automatically select all bodies and have the feature affect those bodies, false to select the bodies the feature affects (see Remarks )

remarks:
A constant thickness is given to the profile when revolving.
The ReverseDir argument has no effect if a mid-plane revolution is specified.
When UseAutoSelect is false, the user must select the bodies that the feature will affect.
When using cut or cavity features that result in multiple bodies, you cannot select to keep all of the resulting bodies or one or more selected bodies.
